ds.util
Class DiGraph<T>

java.lang.Object
  ds.util.DiGraph<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Graph<T>
public class DiGraph<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Graph<T>

An instance of the DiGraph class is a directed weight graph that implements the Graph interface. The class defines methods which provide graph handling operations for vertices and edges with their weights. For applications, the class allows a user to input a graph using the method readGraph and display the structure of a graph using the method toString

Traversal algorithms are the basis for most graph applications. The class provides the method getNeighbors that identifies adjacent vertices which are used in a recursive scan of the graph. Other methods access and update vertex colors, parent references, and data that is associated with vertices as they are identified and visited during a scan.

Constructor Summary
DiGraph()
          Creates an empty graph no vertices or edges.

readGraph

public static DiGraph<java.lang.String> readGraph(java.lang.String filename)
                                           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
Builds a graph whose vertices are strings by reading the vertices and edges from the textfile filename. The format of the file is nVertices vertex_1 vertex_2 ...vertex_n nEdges vertex_i vertex_j weight . . . ...

Parameters:
filename - name of the text file with vertex and edge specifications.
Returns:
DiGraph object with generic type String.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException

vertexSet

public Set<T> vertexSet()
Returns a set view of the vertices in this graph. The set is backed by the graph, so changes to the graph are reflected in the set, and vice-versa. If the map is modified while an iteration over the set is in progress

Specified by:
vertexSet in interface Graph<T>
Returns:
a set view of the vertices in this graph.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string representation of this graph. The description of each vertex includes the name of the vertex, its in-degree and out-degree, and a list of edges and weights that correspond to the adjacent vertices.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
string representation ofthe graph.
